item.title: Experimenting with ML
item.description: Experiment with neural network performance.

item.title: Graphs
item.description: Write a program that implements Breadth-First and Depth-First Search.

item.title: Lab: Songs
item.description: Write SQL queries to answer questions about a database of songs.

item.title: Video poker ♥ ♣ ♠ ♦
item.description: Implement a program that runs a game of video poker.

item.title: Inheritance
item.description: Simulate the inheritance of blood types for each member of a family.

item.title: Recover
item.description: Implement a program that recovers JPEGs from a forensic image.

item.title: Filter: More Comfortable
item.description: Implement a program that applies filters to images.

item.title: Filter: Less Comfortable
item.description: Implement a program that applies filters to images.

item.title: Lab: Volume
item.description: Write a program to modify the volume of an audio file.

item.title: Voting: Tideman
item.description: Implement a program that runs a “Tideman” election, as shown below.

item.description: Implement a program that runs a runoff election, as shown below.

item.title: Plurality
item.description: Implement a program that runs a plurality election, as shown below.

item.title: Lab: Sorting
item.description: Analyze three sorting programs to determine which algorithms they use.

item.title: Substitution
item.description: Implement a program that encrypts messages using the substitution cipher.

item.title: Lab: Password
item.description: Validating passwords.

item.title: Credit
item.description: Validating credit cards…

item.title: Cash
item.description: Making change…

item.title: Mario: Less comfortable
item.description: World 1-1 Toward the end of World 1-1 in Nintendo’s Super Mario Brothers, Mario must ascend a right-aligned pyramid of blocks, as shown below. Let’s recreate that pyramid in C, albeit in text, using hashes (#) for bricks, a la the below. Each hash is a bit taller than it is wide (at least for the font we’re using), so the pyramid itself will also appear taller than it is wide.

item.title: Mario: More comfortable
item.description: World 1-1 Toward the beginning of World 1-1 in Nintendo’s Super Mario Brothers, Mario must hop over adjacent pyramids of blocks, as shown below. Let’s recreate those pyramids in C, albeit in text, using hashes (#) for bricks, a la the below. Each hash is a bit taller than it is wide (at least for the font we’re using), so the pyramids themselves will also appear taller than they are wide.

item.title: Hello
item.description: A simple assignment to practice testing and submitting your code.

item.title: Practice: sum.c
item.description: Write a program called sum.c that asks the user to provide ten integers as input and computes the sum.
